New Records: Bryce Harper reached 20 home runs for the ninth time in his career.
Key Match Events: Bryce Harper hit a home run in the second inning.
Bryce Harper hit a two-run single in the fifth inning.
Nick Castellanos hit a tying triple in the second inning.
Alec Bohm hit his 19th home run in the third inning.
Gregory Soto struck out Mark Vientos with two men on to end the eighth inning.
José Alvarado pitched a perfect ninth inning for his 10th save in 12 chances.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper expressed happiness with reaching 20 home runs and mentioned his recovery from Tommy John surgery.
Bryce Harper emphasized focusing on their own game rather than worrying about other teams.
Zack Wheeler reflected on his performance, stating he was just grinding through the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harper's homer gave the Phillies five players with 20 or more home runs for the third time after 2007 and 2009.
The game was pushed back five hours to 6:05 p.m. EDT because of rain forecast for earlier in the day.
Others: Mets manager Buck Showalter mentioned that despite Tropical Storm Ophelia altering Starling Marte's Triple-A rehab assignment, Marte is expected to rejoin the team for the final weekend of the season.
